alert.note: Alert for Blount; Bradley; Hamilton; Loudon; McMinn; Meigs; Monroe; Polk; Roane; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 12:49PM CDT until August 07 at 1:30PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Bradley County in east Tennessee... Loudon County in east Tennessee... Southeastern Sequatchie County in east Tennessee... Meigs County in east Tennessee... Northwestern Polk County in east Tennessee... McMinn County in east Tennessee... Southwestern Blount County in east Tennessee... Monroe County in east Tennessee... Northeastern Hamilton County in east Tennessee... Southern Roane County in east Tennessee... * Until 230 PM EDT/130 PM CDT/. * At 149 PM EDT/1249 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fairview to near Decatur to near Fairmount, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Maryville, Athens, Lenoir City, Sweetwater, Loudon, Madisonville, Decatur, Soddy-Daisy and Fairview. This includes Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 26 and 77. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT/600 PM CDT/ for east Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Blount; Bradley; Hamilton; Loudon; McMinn; Meigs; Monroe; Polk; Roane; Sequatchie
